creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: largely naked men on horses fighting with spears and clubs; horses rearing slightly over a fallen horse and a fallen man; other men in background with shields
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription

-- inscribed in plate at top: [HERCVLES MVLTIS / BELLIS LACESSIT TROIAM]
-- in graphite on verso, bottom of sheet: B101 | 05 / DTIHKHH
provenance: Ducs d'Arenberg[']; [Melvyn Zabarsky, New Hampshire, until 1980; sold to Tunick]; David Tunick, New York, until February 1982; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, lower right: [HSB]; date in plate, lower left: [1545]
title: Hercules Fighting the Trojans, From the Labors of Hercules
